item.title: What is 5/10 exactly?
item.description: Insane ramblings about the meaning of 'average'.

item.title: Acer Aspire Vero (Antichrist)
item.description: The only thing more stupid than making a laptop out of cheap recycled plastic is the idea that anyone would buy it.

item.title: Paradisus-Paradoxum Collection
item.description: It's an undeniable fact that i'm the worlds biggest fan of MYTH & ROID's hit 2016 single Paradisus-Paradoxum. I've listened to it multiple times every day for around 2.5 years. Naturally, I have come across many covers and variations on the original, for which I have contained on this webpage

item.title: How I Created the Travelers of Agora Road Webring
item.description: The Travelers of Agora Road webring has grown to 20 members, so I thought I would explain the process of creating it, along with the resources I used.

item.title: Yesterweb: Requiem of Silence
item.description: "Selective use of reason is highly characteristic of ideologues. It is then no wonder why the Yesterweb summary is filled with this sort of politically motivated illogy. Itâ€™s no wonder yesterweb remained a fart sniffing contest as opposed to a serious, practical effort to improve anything."

item.title: God Does Not Accept Second Rate Sacrifices
item.description: "I propose that you fully commit to what matters to you, since it's much more rewarding to receive full compensation for your complete efforts than to receive no reward, or even punishment, for putting in not enough effort. God, after all, does not accept second-rate sacrifices."

item.title: Schizo-Ramblings About The Trolley Problem
item.description: "With the realization that allowing the 5 people to die was actually killing them due to omission, my view has changed on the trolley problem. I now believe ontology and consequentialism play a very mute role in this variation. Truly, if in both situations I am killing people, either by commission or omission, then indeed, the ontological belief that life is sacred, and that it should be preserved in the greatest numbers possible holds supreme."
